message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IR 

This paper deals with the problem of class distribution mismatch in the Contextual Emotion Detection task, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper proposes a novel neural architecture, which involves the use of representation of overall context as well as of each utterance, indicating the use of machine learning techniques (cs.LG, cs.AI). The paper also mentions the use of techniques for reducing the distance between the distribution of prediction and ground truth, which could involve methods from computer vision (cs.CV) and information retrieval (cs.IR) fields.
